article.headline: Mississippi State 96, Texas A&M-Corpus Christi 72
article.story: JACKSON, Miss. (AP) -- Ben Hansbrough hit 5 of 6 3-point attempts and all six of his free throws to finish with a career-high 23 points and Mississippi State earned a 96-72 win over Texas A&MCorpus Christi on Saturday. Hansbrough, a freshman and younger brother of North Carolina's Tyler Hansbrough, also had a career-high eight assists and three steals. It was the highest scoring output for the Bulldogs (4-2) this season and five players finished with double-digit point totals. Jamont Gordon had a career-high 24 points and hit 11 of 13 from the free-throw line, while Reginald Delk added 14 and Barry Stewart scored 11. It was the third 20-point game for Gordon in his last four. Vernon Goodridge picked up his first career double-double with 10 points and 10 rebounds. And freshman Jarvis Varnado, starting for the injured Charles Rhodes, led the Bulldogs with five blocked shots in 22 minutes. The Bulldogs nine team blocks were also a season high. Josh Washington led Texas A&M-Corpus Christi with 13.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
